intro: Psilactis crispa, commonly known as the crinkled psilactis, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, crinkled leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for use in traditional medicine. The botanical features of Psilactis crispa make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and pharmacological study.
